name: Hotel Fort Canning

reviews.text: The hotel is situated in Canning Park. Previously it was an army building, so has lots of Colonial appeal. We particularly enjoyed the park as we are always keen to walk in the morning.
reviews.title: An oasis from the bustle of Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in was a little slow, only one working the front desk at a busy time.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the canapes and complimentary drinks after work each day.
reviews.title: inept front desk, and lots of rough edges

reviews.text: The room servicing was uneven, for example not replacing hand towels, and one day not cleaning properly. These items were quickly attended to after we called. It took only 5 minutes for the staff to fix the Nespresso coffee machine in out room.
reviews.title: Great F&B!

reviews.text: The rooms are large, and spacious. Much nicer than your average hotel. It was nice to look out over the park. Interesting mod cons eg light switches in the room.
reviews.title: Gorgeous and a real respite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Set in the middle of Fort Canning Park this lovely hotel is a complete contrast to the general hustle of Singapore. Gorgeous rooms, superbly comfy beds, immaculately clean and although not cheap it is very good value. Free wine & canapes for guests between 6pm & 8pm is a lovely touch. Breakfast buffet is ok but not as good as the rest of the place - best to get there early. Ate in both the expensive Italian - excellent seafood, and the cheaper restaruant which does local food - both very good.
reviews.title: A peaceful oasis in the midst of Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in this fabulous boutique hotel couple of times, as the rates are reasonable and the staffs are warm & friendly. It is a colonial building in a hillside park surrounded by lush greenery, but right in the city centre. A hidden resort but within walking distance to civilization. It's a fairly new hotel to the taxis, just tell them it is in the same building as the former Fort Canning Club.
reviews.title: New World Luxury in Old World Charms

reviews.text: In-house guests are treated to espresso coffee & tea at the hotel lobby all day, with pre-dinner wine & snacks. One really feels at home here. There are 3 swimming pools with poolside shaded beds. The Glass House Cafe serves both local & western cuisine. My favourite is Curry Chicken - made with fresh coconut milk, and for dessert I picked Tao-suan - a local delicacy.
reviews.title: Perfect place to be at Fort Canning

reviews.text: Housed in period building, the stylish rooms have latest gadgets & facilities. Adding to the lifestyle are the Nespresso machine with free espresso capsules, iPad docking station, rain shower & bathtub by the bed/window. I would say it best caters to the 21st Century travellers for a romantic getaway.
reviews.title: A brilliant Hotel

reviews.text: At the same time we felt nostalgic when the room service is delivered in this quaint 'tiffin' carrier (see photo) - reminds one of the good old days.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect !

reviews.text: This was one of the best hotels
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect rooms, hi-tech with a wonderful reception hall with all sorts of amenities
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: Eventually the breakfast was a bit average for this type of hotel, as in construction and not 'living' enough - cold, but still a very good standard
reviews.title: Charming hotel with feel of a boutique

reviews.text: My husband and I had a 3 night stop over in Singapore, and after reviewing many hotels , We settled on Hotel Fort Canning, so glad that we did, we had a fantastic time.
reviews.title: A resort in the heart of Singapore

reviews.text: We stayed in a Premium Room overlooking the Park, The furniture and all the special touches were great. The Pillows are amazing. The bathroom are stunning, loved the shower.
reviews.title: Tranquility in shopping heaven

reviews.text: This boutique property really surprised our senses, in a really good way. We took our parents on a relaxing short vacation to Singapore recently. Usually, we go for the 'Resort' type of accommodation, but through a recommendation by a business colleague, we went for 'Boutique'. Upon arrival, the entrance was well hidden from the main gate entrance. This was nice and appealing as it did not overcome with the fluster of the usual busy traffic to that of a resort. The classically dressed doorman welcomed us and guided us to the reception desk.
reviews.title: Luxurious Hotel Fort Canning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions... Wow. From the stand alone wooden writing desks at reception, to the glass display floor, showing relics from earlier excavations. The reception room sweeps onto a luxurious lounge area with leather loungers available to relax on and with complimentary Nespresso Coffee, Tea, Juice & Bottled water made available to guests.
reviews.title: Luxury in the park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suites are a good size, with king bed and all amenities, seperate stone floor bathrooms, stand alone bath tub & wash basin, large shower with rain forrest shower head & WC.
reviews.title: wonderful an fun trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What places this property above others that I have stayed in over the years, is the extent of the 'Automation' in all rooms: Touch Control Panel, to control lights, air-conditioning and all the drapes & curtains. If you do not want to use the touch control, you can control using the television control panel, which also gives complimentary internet & email access. Fantastic.
reviews.title: designed and well located hotel

reviews.text: The restaurant, to which we had breakfast daily, is great, not too crowded, very relaxed.
reviews.title: Awesome!

description: Surrounded by the lush greenery of a historical park, the heritage Hotel Fort Canning offers a discreet sanctuary of calm in the vibrant city and an epitome of style and modern comfort in each of its 86 guestrooms and suites.
